TypeSignature.Value: .class public auto ansi serializable sealed beforefieldinit DefaultDependencyAttribute extends System.Attribute
Public NotInheritable Class DefaultDependencyAttribute Inherits Attribute
public ref class DefaultDependencyAttribute sealed : Attribute

Docs.summary: Provides a hint to the common language runtime (CLR) indicating how likely a dependency is to be loaded. This class is used in a dependent assembly to indicate what hint should be used when the parent does not specify the attribute. This class cannot be inherited.

remarks.format:
## Remarks This attribute is used by the [Ngen.exe (Native Image Generator)](~/docs/framework/tools/ngen-exe-native-image-generator.md) to generate native assembly images.
Apply the <xref:System.Runtime.CompilerServices.DefaultDependencyAttribute> attribute to a dependent assembly to determine the preferred default binding.
A dependency that is likely to be loaded (<xref:System.Runtime.CompilerServices.LoadHint.Always>) will cause Ngen.exe to bind to that dependency. Using this hint allows Ngen.exe to generate code that will result in a reduced working set and improved throughput but at the cost of always loading the dependency when the parent assembly is loaded.
When you apply the <xref:System.Runtime.CompilerServices.DependencyAttribute> attribute to an assembly with a value of <xref:System.Runtime.CompilerServices.LoadHint.Default>, the native image generation service consults the dependent assembly for its preferred default binding, which is specified by the <xref:System.Runtime.CompilerServices.DefaultDependencyAttribute> attribute.
## Examples The following code example demonstrates how to apply the <xref:System.Runtime.CompilerServices.DefaultDependencyAttribute> attribute to an assembly to specify that the dependency is likely to be loaded.
[!code-csharp[Runtime.CompilerServices.DefaultDependencyAttribute#1](~/samples/snippets/csharp/VS_Snippets_CLR/Runtime.CompilerServices.DefaultDependencyAttribute/cs/example.cs#1)] [!code-vb[Runtime.CompilerServices.DefaultDependencyAttribute#1](~/samples/snippets/visualbasic/VS_Snippets_CLR/Runtime.CompilerServices.DefaultDependencyAttribute/vb/example.vb#1)]

MemberSignature.Value: .method public hidebysig specialname rtspecialname instance void .ctor(valuetype System.Runtime.CompilerServices.LoadHint loadHintArgument) cil managed

Docs.param: One of the values that indicates the default binding preference.
Docs.summary: Initializes a new instance of the class with the specified binding.

remarks.format:
## Examples The following code example demonstrates how to apply the <xref:System.Runtime.CompilerServices.DefaultDependencyAttribute> attribute to an assembly to specify that the dependency is likely to be loaded.
[!code-csharp[Runtime.CompilerServices.DefaultDependencyAttribute#1](~/samples/snippets/csharp/VS_Snippets_CLR/Runtime.CompilerServices.DefaultDependencyAttribute/cs/example.cs#1)] [!code-vb[Runtime.CompilerServices.DefaultDependencyAttribute#1](~/samples/snippets/visualbasic/VS_Snippets_CLR/Runtime.CompilerServices.DefaultDependencyAttribute/vb/example.vb#1)]

MemberSignature.Value: Public ReadOnly Property LoadHint As LoadHint

Docs.summary: Gets the value that indicates when an assembly loads a dependency.

remarks.format: ## Remarks Use this property to return the value of the <xref:System.Runtime.CompilerServices.LoadHint> enumeration used by the <xref:System.Runtime.CompilerServices.DefaultDependencyAttribute> attribute.
